eligibility:
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Research Skills Access to modern technologies and tools Build Global Perspective Interdisciplinary Approach Community Engagement and Service Learning Student Led Initiatives
what_learn: What you will learn? The program places a strong emphasis on research skills and experiential learning. Students engage in practicums, service learning, internships, and continuous internal assessments (CIAs) in field settings, promoting practical application of knowledge. Discipline-Specific Elective (DSE) courses expose students to various specialized fields within psychology, broadening their understanding of the subject and career prospects. The program promotes interdisciplinary inquiry by offering exposure to various disciplines, including Computer Science, Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, Business studies, Commerce, English, and Economics. The interdisciplinary approach enriches students' perspectives and enhances their problem-solving abilities. Students have access to well-equipped psychological labs and resources, providing them with the tools and environment needed for comprehensive research and experimentation.
